short_summary: CFIA seeks to purchase office chairs for delivery and installation in Saint-Hyacinthe, QC
description: The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) has a requirement for the purchase, delivery and installation of office seating to Saint-Hyacinthe, QC.  Only suppliers who are pre-qualified and have been issued a supply arrangement are eligible to bid.
full_summary:
# Office Seating Required
=======

## Government Tender Announcement

The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) is seeking a supplier to provide office seating for its location in Saint-Hyacinthe, QC.

## Tender Details

- **Tender Number**: 2024-00464
- **Solicitation Reference**: cb-718-98817302
- **Tender Issue Date**: December 12, 2023
- **Tender Closing Date**: December 22, 2023 at 14:00:00 (EST)
- **Expected Contract Start Date**: January 5, 2024
- **Expected Contract End Date**: March 15, 2024
- **Tender Status**: Expired

## Goods and Services Required

The CFIA is seeking a supplier to provide office chairs and office furniture. The UNSPSC codes for this requirement are 56101504 (Chairs) and 56101700 (Office furniture).

## Selection Criteria

The successful bidder will be selected based on the Lowest Price criterion.

## Tenders and Attachments

The tender notice, including the Request for Proposal (RFP) document, and attachments are available for download from the Canada Buys website at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/27328/2024-00464-request-for-proposal-%28rfp.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/27328/2024-00464-request-for-proposal-%28rfp.pdf).

## Contact Information

For any questions or concerns, please contact Catherine Clairoux, procurement representative at the CFIA, via email at catherine.clairoux@inspection.gc.ca or by phone at (343) 596-9265.  NOTE: The tender is not eligible for trade agreements due to being expired. Overall process and timeline remain intact/valid.  However, it's worth mentioning that the tender cannot proceed under normal trade agreements with vendors after being expired/missed deadline.
